message.content:
cs.CV, cs.GR, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.MM

This paper deals with the consolidation of point clouds obtained from 3D scans, which is a common problem in computer vision and graphics. The paper proposes a deep learning-based approach to address this problem, which involves processing local patches of points and learning to consolidate points specifically for edges. This suggests that the paper is likely to be relevant to several arXiv CS sub-categories, including computer vision (cs.CV), graphics (cs.GR), machine learning (cs.LG), artificial intelligence (cs.AI), and multimedia (cs.MM). Among these, computer vision and graphics are the most likely categories, as they are directly related to the problem of point cloud consolidation and are mentioned explicitly in the abstract. Machine learning and artificial intelligence are also likely categories, as the paper proposes a deep learning-based approach. Multimedia is a less likely category, but it is still possible that the paper could be relevant to this field, as it deals with 3D reconstructions and point clouds, which are commonly used in multimedia applications such as virtual reality and gaming.
